text: Selhurst railway station is a train station in Selhurst, South London in London Borough of Croydon. The station opened in 1868. It is served by Southern. It is in Fare Zone 4. == Platforms == There are 4 platforms at Selhurst. Platform 1 is for southbound services towards Caterham, East Croydon, Sutton and Epsom. Platform 2 is for northbound services towards London Victoria and London Bridge. Platforms 3 is for fast southbound services and platform 4 is for fast northbound services that pass this station. == Frequency == === Up (Northbound) === * 2tph to London Victoria * 2tph to London Bridge via Streatham and Peckham Rye * 1tph to Watford Junction === Down (Southbound) === * 3tph to East Croydon * 2tph to Epsom Downs via West Croydon and Sutton == Departures == Train Towards Calling Points Approximate Journey Time Southern London Victoria Thornton Heath, Norbury, Streatham Common, Balham, Wandsworth Common, Clapham Junction, Battersea Park 28 minutes Southern London Bridge Thornton Heath, Norbury, Streatham Common, Streatham, Tulse Hill, North Dulwich, East Dulwich, Peckham Rye, Queens Road Peckham, South Bermondsey 36 minutes Southern East Croydon Terminus 3 minutes Southern Epsom Downs West Croydon, Waddon, Wallington, Carshalton Beeches, Sutton, Belmont, Banstead 29 minutes == Buses == London Buses route 75 and 157 serve this station. == References == == Other websites == * Selhurst station facilities Category:Rail transport stations in London fare zone 4 Category:1868 establishments in the United Kingdom Category:1860s establishments in England Category:Railway stations opened in 1868 Category:Railway stations in the London Borough of Croydon
